key_points: Millions of Americans have received the third round of stimulus payments.
Those eligible but yet to receive their payment may have issues with incorrect bank account information.
The IRS cannot update bank account information through the Get My Payment tool.
If incorrect bank info is provided, the bank will return the payment to the IRS, which will then mail a check to the address on file.
Filing a 2020 tax return electronically with an updated address can help correct this issue.
The IRS suggests setting up direct deposit through the Get My Payment portal once the original payment is returned.
The 'Need More Information' message in the portal indicates an opportunity to set up direct deposit.
Bank account information used by the IRS comes from the most recently processed tax return or other sources such as federal benefit agencies.
The possibility of a fourth stimulus check is reduced due to latest job data.
Those without direct deposit information on file with the IRS may have their info drawn from federal records.
